etymologies: late Middle English: from late Latin diaphragma, from Greek, from dia ‘through, apart’ + phragma ‘a fence’

definitions: a dome-shaped muscular partition separating the thorax from the abdomen in mammals. It plays a major role in breathing, as its contraction increases the volume of the thorax and so inflates the lungs.
shortDefinitions: muscular partition separating thorax from abdomen

definitions: a thin sheet of material forming a partition.
a taut flexible membrane in mechanical or acoustic systems.
shortDefinitions: flexible membrane in mechanical etc. systems

definitions: a thin contraceptive cap fitting over the cervix.
a device for varying the effective aperture of the lens in a camera or other optical system.
shortDefinitions: device varying aperture of camera lens
